Dear Principal,

I am writing to propose a new idea that I believe will greatly benefit our school and community. I strongly suggest that all students perform community service as a regular part of their academic curriculum.

There are many reasons why I believe this idea is worth considering. Firstly, performing community service can help students develop important skills that will serve them well in the future. For example, volunteering can help students develop empathy, communication skills, and leadership skills. These skills are essential for success in both personal and professional life.

Secondly, community service can help students connect with their community and understand the needs and challenges faced by those around them. By volunteering, students can gain a better understanding of the issues facing their community and develop a sense of responsibility for addressing them.

Finally, community service can have a positive impact on the school as a whole. By involving students in community service projects, we can foster a sense of school pride and community involvement. This can help to create a positive and supportive school culture, which can lead to better academic performance and a more engaged student body.

I understand that implementing this idea may require some resources and planning. However, I believe that the benefits of community service will far outweigh any costs. By involving all students in community service, we can create a more well-rounded and engaged student body that will benefit our school and community for years to come.

In conclusion, I strongly recommend that all students perform community service as a regular part of their academic curriculum. I believe that this idea will have a positive impact on our school and community, and I am confident that it will be well received by students, parents, and teachers alike.

Thank you for considering my proposal.

Sincerely,

Mr. Nothing held his thumb over the red button. "If I press this button," he started. "The entire world will be destroyed." "Don't do it!" yelled a passerby on the sidewalk. Others just walked by casually. "I won't do it," Mr. Nothing explained, "as long the world heeds my advice.'Be Kind.' Is that too much to ask?" "Hey, buddy," another pedestrian said to the yelling passerby. "He's holding a red pen." "Oh," he said. "Still, though." He waved for Mr. Nothing's attention. "You want people to be kind, but destroying the world isn't very kind, is it?" Mr. Nothing raised an eyebrow. "Huh," he said. "That's a good point." He slipped the pen into his pocket. As he began walking, he suddenly stopped. "Wait a minute," he said. "Pointing out someone's mistake isn't very kind. But then again, I'm doing the same thing. I need to rethink my life."

In the year 2089, technology had advanced beyond what anyone could have ever imagined. "Mind Transfer" technology had turned science fiction into science fact. With this technology, it was now possible to transfer your consciousness from one body to another. The technology was groundbreaking, but it came at a cost. A new form of identity theft had emerged, and it was taking the world by storm. The "Identity Black Market" had been born. The identity black market was a place where people could buy and sell stolen minds. Criminals would steal someone's identity, transfer their consciousness into another body, and sell the stolen identity on the black market to the highest bidder. For a hefty price, anyone could buy a new life, a new body, and a new identity. People who were tired of their lives in their old, worn-out bodies could trade them in for a fresh, younger, and healthier model. The black market had become so prevalent that it was almost impossible to tell who was who. Anyone could be a stolen identity, someone's consciousness crammed into someone else's body, never able to go back to their own life. The world was in chaos, and governments were struggling to keep pace with the new criminal tactics. It was a game of cat and mouse, with the criminals always one step ahead. But there was still hope, there were still those who were fighting to keep their own identities intact, and the black market at bay. These people had to be careful, though, because they never knew who might be listening, watching, or even inside their own skin. The identity black market was a scary place, a world where nothing was as it seemed, a world where you never really knew who you were, or who you were dealing with. It was a place where identity theft had taken on a whole new meaning, where your mind was no longer your own, and where your body was no longer your sanctuary.

"A Day Without Cars" is a revolutionary initiative aimed at reducing air pollution and encouraging alternative forms of transportation. This event has been observed in Bogotá, Colombia, for three consecutive years, with millions of people leaving their cars at home and opting for hiking, biking, skating, or public transportation instead. The initiative has also been adopted by other Colombian cities such as Cali and Valledupar, and has drawn interest from international municipal authorities. 

The significance of this initiative goes beyond just reducing air pollution, as it has transformed the cityscape and lifestyle in Bogotá. The urban improvement campaign started in the mid-1990s, and it has resulted in the construction of 118 miles of bicycle paths, the most in Latin America, and significant urban developments, including new parks, sports centers, improved sidewalks, reduced rush-hour traffic, and burgeoning restaurant and shopping districts. These developments have improved the quality of life for the city's residents, making it a more livable place.

The success of the initiative is attributed to its focus on promoting alternative forms of transportation. By encouraging people to leave their cars at home and use other modes of transportation, the initiative has reduced stress levels and increased physical activity for residents, leading to a healthier and happier population. Additionally, the initiative has had a positive impact on the environment, reducing the amount of pollution caused by cars and promoting a cleaner, more sustainable city.

The initiative has also been praised for its ability to bring people together and promote social cohesion. The car has been a symbol of individualism and separation, but the initiative encourages people to interact and build a sense of community. This is particularly important in Bogotá, a city that has been plagued by social and economic disparities, where the initiative has helped to bridge the gap between different communities.

In conclusion, the "Day Without Cars" initiative has been a remarkable success in promoting alternative forms of transportation, reducing air pollution, and improving the quality of life for the residents of Bogotá. The initiative has also had a positive impact on the environment and has promoted social cohesion, making it a model for other cities around the world. It is essential for citizens to understand the benefits of limiting the use of cars and promoting alternative forms of transportation to create a healthier, happier, and more sustainable future for everyone.

This work presents a novel method to generate secret keys shared between a legitimate node pair (Alice and Bob) to safeguard the communication between them from an unauthorized node (Eve). The proposed method is based on an ultra-wideband (UWB) signal transmitted from Alice to Bob. The UWB signal is modulated using physical layer network coding (PNC). In PNC, the data is encoded by applying a function on two or more signals, which is then transmitted over the same channel in a single transmission. This allows for multiple users to be communicated simultaneously and securely. The UWB signal is received at Bob, who then extracts the secret key from the PNC-encoded signal. This key is then used to encrypt the communication between Alice and Bob. To ensure secure communication, the proposed method also implements a random number generator (RNG) to generate a set of random numbers that are used to construct the secret key. This RNG utilizes chaotic systems to generate random numbers with high entropy and low predictability, which makes it difficult for Eve to guess the generated key. In addition, the proposed method uses artificial intelligence (AI) -based techniques to detect malicious nodes and prevent them from accessing the key. AI-based techniques such as deep learning and machine learning can be used to identify malicious nodes by analyzing their behavior. Overall, the proposed method provides a secure and robust way to generate secret keys between two legitimate nodes, while preventing unauthorized access from malicious nodes.

In Australia, nonprofit organisations include trade unions, charitable entities, co-operatives, universities and hospitals, mutual societies, grass-root and support groups, political parties, religious groups, incorporated associations, not-for-profit companies, trusts and more. Furthermore, they operate across a multitude of domains and industries, from health, employment, disability and other human services to local sporting clubs, credit unions and research institutes. A nonprofit organisation in Australia can choose from a number of legal forms depending on the needs and activities of the organisation: co-operative, company limited by guarantee, unincorporated association, incorporated association (by the Associations Incorporation Act 1985) or incorporated association or council (by the Commonwealth Aboriginal Councils and Associations Act 1976). From an academic perspective, social enterprise is for the most part considered a sub-set of the nonprofit sector as typically they too are concerned with a purpose relating to a public good, however these are not bound to adhere to a nonprofit legal structure and many incorporate and operate as for-profit entities.

A code C F n is a collection of M codewords where n elements (from the finite field F) in each of the codewords are referred to as code blocks. Assuming that F is a degree extension of a smaller field B , the code blocks are treated as -length vectors over the base field B . Equivalently, the code is said to have the sub-packetization level . This paper addresses the problem of constructing MDS codes that enable exact reconstruction (repair) of each code block by downloading small amount of information from the remaining code blocks. The total amount of information flow from the remaining code blocks during this reconstruction process is referred to as repair-bandwidth of the underlying code. The problem of enabling exact reconstruction of a code block with small repair bandwidth naturally arises in the context of distributed storage systems as the node repair problem . The constructions of exact-repairable MDS codes with optimal repair-bandwidth require working with large sub-packetization levels, which restricts their employment in practice. This paper presents constructions for MDS codes that simultaneously provide both small repair bandwidth and small sub-packetization level. In particular, this paper presents two general approaches to construct exact-repairable MDS codes that aim at significantly reducing the required sub-packetization level at the cost of slightly sub-optimal repair bandwidth. The first approach provides MDS codes that have repair bandwidth at most twice the optimal repair-bandwidth. Additionally, these codes also have the smallest possible sub-packetization level O (r), where r denotes the number of parity blocks. This approach is then generalized to design codes that have their repair bandwidth approaching the optimal repair-bandwidth at the cost of graceful increment in the required sub-packetization level. The second approach provides ways to transform an MDS code with optimal repair-bandwidth and large sub-packetization level into a longer MDS code with small sub-packetization level and near-optimal repair bandwidth. For a given number of parity blocks, the codes constructed using this approach have their sub-packetization level scaling logarithmically with the code length. In addition, the obtained codes require field size only linear in the code length and ensure load balancing among the intact code blocks in terms of the information downloaded from these blocks during the exact reconstruction of a code block.

Judaism shares some of the characteristics of a nation, an ethnicity, a religion, and a culture, making the definition of who is a Jew vary slightly depending on whether a religious or national approach to identity is used. Generally, in modern secular usage Jews include three groups: people who were born to a Jewish family regardless of whether or not they follow the religion, those who have some Jewish ancestral background or lineage (sometimes including those who do not have strictly matrilineal descent), and people without any Jewish ancestral background or lineage who have formally converted to Judaism and therefore are followers of the religion.

The cub will be the first giant panda to be born in Hong Kong. Earlier this year, 10-year-old Ying Ying mated naturally and was also artificially inseminated. However, the staff at Ocean Park are unsure which method has resulted in the successful pregnancy. Ying Ying was sent to mainland China's Sichuan province this spring to take part in a breeding programme. The 100kg female - described by the park as "inquisitive, active and vigilant" - attempted to mate naturally with two male pandas on five different occasions and one of the attempts was deemed successful. But to improve the chances of a viable pregnancy, Ying Ying was also artificially inseminated. Repeated ultrasound scans in late September confirmed she was carrying a foetus, Ocean Park officials said. Two panda maternity specialists have travelled to Hong Kong from Sichuan to provide pre- and post-natal support and the park's executive director of zoological operations Suzanne Gendron said she was "cautiously optimistic" about the birth. Panda reproduction is a notoriously difficult process, with females only ovulating once a year. It is common for giant pandas to re-absorb the foetus into the womb in the late stages of pregnancy. The gestation period is typically five months and one or two cubs are usually born.

Dear [State Senator],

I am writing to express my opinion on the Electoral College system used to elect the President of the United States. While some argue that the Electoral College is outdated and unfair, I believe it is still an essential part of our democratic process.

One of the primary arguments in favor of the Electoral College is that it ensures a more accurate reflection of the popular vote. As Bradford Plumer notes in his article "The Indefensible Electoral College," the winner of the popular vote has only lost the presidency five times since 1824. This is due to the fact that the Electoral College system awards electoral votes based on the number of representatives each state has in Congress, rather than the total population of the state. This means that smaller states have a disproportionate amount of influence in the election, which can lead to a more representative outcome.

Another argument in favor of the Electoral College is that it encourages candidates to campaign in a wider range of states. As Judge Richard A. Posner notes in his article "In Defense of the Electoral College," the winner-take-all system used in most states means that candidates have a strong incentive to focus their campaign efforts on swing states. This leads to a more engaged electorate in those states and ensures that the President-elect has a broad base of support across the country.

However, there are also counterarguments against the Electoral College. One of the most common criticisms is that it can lead to a candidate winning the presidency without receiving the most popular votes. This is exactly what happened in the 2000 election, when George W. Bush won the presidency despite losing the popular vote to Al Gore. This can be seen as undemocratic and unfair to voters who supported

Wal-Mart’s Initial Public Offering Research Paper

When a private company begins to sell its shares to the general members of the public or institutional investors for the first time, it is known as an Initial Public Offering. In most instances, about 20-30 percent of shares of a company which go public are set free in the stock market (Waldon, 2012). One of the dominant reasons for any IPO is to seek surplus capital for growth and expansion. This was the case with Wal-Mart retail store when it opted to go public. Before the Wal-Mart’s IPO, additional expansion funds were sought from local banks. However, these were not enough to execute growth plans (Friesen & Swift, 2009).

During the Wal-Mart’s IPO, investment banks bought the securities that had been put afloat by the company as part of their role in underwriting. They also sold the shares to the target market on behalf of the issuer (Wal-Mart). In other words, the offering risk is usually taken care of by the investment banks during the underwriting process (Gregoriou, 2011). Other investment banks that assist in the underwriting process are known as the originating house. They are sought investment banks to assist in the IPO process. Hence, an underwriting syndicate is formed from this type of arrangement. Members of the syndicate determine the number of shares to be received by each stakeholder as well as the pricing plan. Eventually, a binding agreement is signed.

References

Friesen, G.C. & Swift, C. (2009). Overreaction in the thrift IPO aftermarket. Journal of Banking & Finance, 33 (7), 1285–1298.

Gregoriou, G.N. (2011). Initial Public Offerings (IPO): An International Perspective of IPOs . Oxford: Elsevier Inc.

Waldon, G. (2012). Wal-Mart IPO Set the Stage for Global Expansion . Web.

Free Relationship and Kant’s Principles Essay

In this case, a man leaves a woman who is pregnant with his baby, however, both of them have a clear understanding of the situation, which means that Kant’s principles are not broken (Ruggiero 96). The woman agreed to have free relationships, and her partner accepted her decision to have a child. Both parties decided that it was normal for them not to change the situation. The woman understood that she could be left and she accepted this situation. However, the way she was informed about the fact that their relationship ended should be discussed, as it caused a moral issue (whether it was right or wrong to leave without saying anything). The man left a note and did not let his partner understand what happened. He decided not to tell her everything face-to-face, which means that he did not have enough respect for her. According to the good will theory that was developed by Kant and the principle of respect for persons, he should have explained the situation in person.

It is also vital to pay attention to the fact that the woman was pregnant. Their relationship presupposed no boundaries and allowed both individuals to have other partners, which opposes the good will theory (Burnor and Raley 156). In Kant’s point of view, the man should help his partner to take care of the child. Even though there is no information about his actions towards the baby, his note allows thinking that the man was not going to take this responsibility (Paul and Elder 20). However, if it turns out that he participates in the woman’s life and the life of his child, no principles will be broken. In case he decides to become a good father in the course of time, Kant’s theory will not support and approve his actions, as he has already ignored the universal moral duty to take care of his baby.

Works Cited

Burnor, Richard, and Yvonne Raley. Ethical Choices . Oxford University Press, 2011.

Paul, Richard, and Linda Elder. Critical Thinking . Foundation for Critical Thinking Press, 2009.

Ruggiero, Vinsent. Thinking Critically About Ethical Issues . McGraw-Hill Education, 2014.

A student has had her prison sentence cut after she was found guilty of faking terminal cancer in order to con a former lecturer out of thousands of pounds. Courtney King, 22, was sentenced to two years and eight months in prison last year after pleading guilty to fraud charges. However, the Court of Appeal has now reduced this to one year and three months. King had created a fake online profile in order to contact a former lecturer from her college. She claimed to have terminal cancer and asked for money to pay for treatment. The lecturer transferred over 4,000 to King's bank account, and when he realised he had been conned he reported the matter to the police. The court heard that King had used the money for holidays, clothes and other luxury items. She was also found to have targeted another person online in a similar way and taken money from them, too. Speaking after the ruling, Judge Michael Chambers QC said: "It is clear that to commit these offences you took advantage of people who were vulnerable and generous. You sought to take advantage of their generosity by creating a false persona." The judge added that while King had shown remorse for her actions, it was not enough to keep her out of prison. He said that a custodial sentence was necessary to send a message to those tempted to commit similar crimes.

There is a famous quote that states, “The best way to predict the future is to create it.” This quote can be interpreted in many ways, but one way is to see it as a call to action. It is a reminder that we should not just sit back and wait for things to happen, but rather that we should take an active role in shaping our own future.

There are many ways to create the future. One way is to simply set goals and work towards them. When we have a goal in mind, it gives us something to strive for and helps us to stay motivated. It also helps us to make decisions that are in line with our goals.

Another way to create the future is to be proactive. This means taking the initiative and making things happen. It means being willing to take risks and try new things. It also means being persistent and not giving up easily.

Finally, we can create the future by being positive and optimistic. When we believe in ourselves and our ability to achieve our goals, we are more likely to succeed. A positive attitude can also help us to overcome challenges and setbacks.

Creating the future is not always easy. There will be times when we face challenges and setbacks. However, if we stay focused on our goals, remain proactive, and maintain a positive attitude, we can overcome these challenges and create the future we desire.

In addition to the above, there are many other ways to create the future. Here are a few more ideas:

* Be open to new ideas and experiences.
* Be willing to learn and grow.
* Be creative and innovative.
* Be passionate about your goals.
* Surround yourself with positive people.
* Take action and make things happen.

The future is ours to create. Let’s make it a bright one!

Unraveling the Mysteries of Life: The Discovery of DNA Structure
For centuries, scientists have been fascinated by the building blocks of life, seeking to uncover the mysteries that lie within the tiny strands of deoxyribonucleic acid, more commonly known as DNA. This genetic material holds the instructions for everything from eye color to predisposition for certain diseases, making its study crucial to our understanding of biology, medicine, and even human origins. The journey towards discovering the structure of DNA has been long and winding, filled with breakthroughs, setbacks, and fierce competition among some of the greatest minds in science. In this essay, we will delve into the rich history of DNA's structure discovery, examining the key players, their contributions, and the impact these findings had on the world of science and beyond.

In the early 20th century, scientists were already aware of the existence of DNA, but its true purpose and structure remained elusive. It was not until the mid-1940s that significant progress began to be made. One of the pioneers in this field was American biochemist Oswald Avery, who conducted groundbreaking research on bacterial transformation. Through his experiments, he discovered that a substance he called "transforming principle" could change the properties of one strain of bacteria to another. Although Avery did not identify this transforming principle as DNA at the time, his work laid the foundation for future studies on gene transfer and inheritance.

As interest in DNA grew, so too did the race to determine its structure. Two names stand out among the many involved in this pursuit: James Watson and Francis Crick. These young scientists, working together at Cambridge University, were determined to crack the code of life. Drawing upon the earlier work of Rosalind Franklin, Maurice Wilkins, and others, they developed a model of DNA consisting of two intertwined helices, now famously known as the double helix. Their landmark paper, published in Nature in 1953, revolutionized the field of molecular biology and earned them the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1962.

But how exactly did Watson and Crick arrive at their groundbreaking discovery? They started by analyzing X-ray diffraction patterns taken by Rosalind Franklin, which provided valuable insights into the arrangement of atoms within the DNA molecule. Using these clues, along with their knowledge of chemistry and previous research, they constructed various models of DNA using cardboard cutouts and metal rods. After countless iterations and refinements, they finally hit upon the iconic double helix shape, which elegantly explained how genetic information could be stored and replicated.

The importance of Watson and Crick's discovery cannot be overstated. Not only did it reveal the physical basis for heredity, but it also opened up new possibilities for exploring the inner workings of living organisms. Scientists around the world took notice, and soon the field of molecular biology experienced tremendous growth. Researchers began to investigate topics such as DNA replication, transcription, and translation - processes

Not at all. In fact, the writer Andrew Solomon, who has become known for writing about depression (see The Noonday Demon), has explored depression in non-western societies. He went to Nepal and found that the predominant anxiety here is not one of fear but a sense of shame - an inability or unwillingness to share their feelings with others, especially strangers. This view was supported by a study done on depression in five cultures around the world: Bangladesh, Cambodia, Vietnam, Thailand and Nigeria. It turns out that in each culture, people are most afraid when they're desperate to get help from others, particularly if it's something as complex and difficult as depression. Even among those who know they have depression, they don't feel as comfortable in talking about it openly with friends and family members because no matter how much they want them to go through with it, they'll be judged by others for doing so. Instead, what people do instead is accept the treatment offered by doctors and other medical professionals, which can often include medication. This approach may seem effective, yet only 20 of depressed patients actually take antidepressant drugs as recommended by their doctor. Sharing their experiences with illness isn't easy either. A survey I did three years ago showed that almost 50 of people surveyed didn't tell anyone they had depression. Some said "I'm fine" even though they knew they weren't; others claimed they'd told someone once before but then stopped because they were embarrassed, ashamed, afraid of rejection, overwhelmed by tasks involved with getting things together or experiencing flashbacks. In India, where less than 40 of both men and women are open about having depression, many people simply avoid saying anything because there aren't any good answers for why this should happen. Sometimes you just need some support. The social stigma surrounding depression makes it harder for individuals to seek help and can also keep them isolated from others. When we talk about mental health issues more directly, society itself becomes a barrier to dealing with our own emotions. Depression also leads us to doubt ourselves and create self-limiting beliefs that ironically prevent us from seeking professional help again. All these elements contribute to creating a vicious cycle that prevents millions of Americans from getting the services they need. But we can make changes that might change this. And if we start now, maybe tomorrow could be different.

The struggle against colonial rule has been a defining feature of the modern era, with anti-colonial independence movements emerging across the globe in the pursuit of self-determination and liberation. These movements have adopted diverse strategies and pursued a range of goals, contributing to significant outcomes that have reshaped the political landscape of the world.

One of the primary goals of anti-colonial independence movements has been the establishment of sovereign nation-states. Colonized peoples have sought to break free from the political, economic, and social control of foreign powers, asserting their right to self-governance and the preservation of their cultural identities. This aspiration has driven movements such as the Indian independence movement led by Mahatma Gandhi, the Algerian National Liberation Front's fight against French colonialism, and the Vietnamese struggle for independence under Ho Chi Minh.

To achieve their objectives, anti-colonial movements have employed various strategies. Some have engaged in armed resistance, resorting to guerrilla warfare and military campaigns to challenge colonial forces. The Mau Mau uprising in Kenya against British colonial rule and the Cuban Revolution led by Fidel Castro exemplify this approach. Other movements have pursued nonviolent resistance, utilizing civil disobedience, strikes, and mass protests to pressure colonial powers. The Indian National Congress under Gandhi's leadership is a prominent example of this strategy.

The outcomes of anti-colonial independence movements have been far-reaching and transformative. The decolonization process has resulted in the emergence of numerous independent nations, altering the global balance of power and challenging the dominance of European colonial empires. The end of colonialism has also contributed to the spread of democracy and human rights, as newly independent nations have adopted more representative forms of government and sought to protect the rights of their citizens.

However, the process of decolonization has not been without its challenges. Many newly independent nations have faced internal conflicts, economic disparities, and political instability. The legacy of colonialism continues to impact these nations, shaping their political systems, economic structures, and social dynamics.

Despite these challenges, anti-colonial independence movements have played a pivotal role in shaping the modern world. They have contributed to the dismantling of oppressive colonial systems, the promotion of self-determination, and the advancement of human rights. The ongoing struggle for justice and equality continues to be inspired by these movements, as people around the world strive to build a more just and equitable global order.

Once upon a time, in a quaint little town, there was a group of students who attended a prestigious school. This school was known for its rigorous academic curriculum and the emphasis it placed on the overall development of its students. The administration believed that students should be completely immersed in their education and refrain from any distractions that could hinder their learning experience. As a result, the school implemented a strict no-phone policy within its premises.

However, as the years passed by, technology advanced at an unprecedented rate. The world was becoming increasingly interconnected, and the students felt the need to keep up with the pace of progress. They argued that the school's no-phone policy was antiquated and out of touch with the modern world. They believed that phones were not just tools for communication but also valuable educational resources.

The students argued that allowing them to bring their phones to school would provide them with numerous benefits. For instance, they could use their phones to access the internet, which would enable them to conduct research, collaborate with their peers, and stay up-to-date with current events. They also pointed out that phones could serve as a means of communication with their parents and guardians in case of emergencies, ensuring their safety and well-being.

Furthermore, the students argued that phones could be used to enhance their learning experience by providing them with instant access to various educational apps, e-books, and other resources. They believed that these tools could complement their textbooks and other learning materials, ultimately improving their academic performance.

On the other hand, there were those who argued against the idea of allowing students to bring their phones to school. They believed that phones could be a significant source of distraction, leading to a decline in students' academic performance. They argued that phones could be used for non-academic purposes, such as texting, social media, and gaming, which could disrupt the learning environment and hinder students' focus on their education.

Moreover, some members of the faculty and administration argued that allowing phones in school could create a potential security risk. Phones, especially smartphones, contain sensitive information and could be used to compromise the school's network and data. They also highlighted the possibility of students using their phones to cheat during exams, which could compromise the integrity of the academic system.

In conclusion, the debate over whether students should be allowed to bring their phones to school is a complex and multifaceted issue. While the pros of allowing phones in school include increased access to educational resources, communication, and potential security benefits, the cons involve distractions, potential security risks, and academic dishonesty. Ultimately, the decision to allow or ban phones in school lies in the hands of the administration and should be approached with careful consideration of the potential benefits and drawbacks.

**Topic: Countries are becoming more and more similar because people are able to buy the same products anywhere in the world. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?**  
  
## **United World**

  
  
With technologic developments, people can reach out anything easily. People can access any laptop, car or food from long-distance countries. It can be an excellent opportunity for everyone. However, it has some negative aspects such as to cause monopolisation and killing the local business.  
  
The first negative effect of globalisation is that it is killing the local business. These days, a company which has money and power can spread easily all over the world. If a company spread all over the world, other small business which are selling similar products in the country will affect harmful. For instance, when a corporation who is selling vegetables and fruits enter the market in a country, a food supplier sell in the country will be affected harmfully. A company will sell the similar vegetables on half price. So that, a food supplier will be bankrupt.  
  
The second negative effect of globalisation is that it causes monopolisation. When a company has too much power, it does not allow to grow enterprises that do the same job with this company. It is always good to have opponent firms for us. Also, monopolisation leads do not care about us because they are the one option for us. For instance, UberEats which is a firm delivery food changed their mediation fees %3 to %10 less than one year. After that restaurants increased their food prices and today, we should buy food more expensive than the past.  
  
As a result, to able to buy the same products can be seen a good opportunity for us. However, it comes with a lot of issue like monopolisation and killing the local business. We should consider negative sides of this and take action about it.

Dear Principal,

I just read the two possible cell phone policies. I think that the school should use the first policy, that said you should allow students to bring phones to school and use them during lunch periods and other free times, as long as the phones are turned off during class time.

I agree with this policy because I think if the students are using their cell phones in the hallway, it is not interrupting or distracting to classes. Another reason I think the first policy is better is that if the students need something, like a ride home from school, they can call there parents during passing periods to tell them that they will be staying after school later and what time to pick them up. That way they will not have to go to the office to call during class. Doing this, they will not have to miss anything in class.

Students should be able to use cell phones at lunch because it is not even a class. They should be able to text or call people during that time. The teachers should allow students to use their cell phones because there is no reason they shouldn't be able to use them at lunch. Lunch and passing periods are supposed to be breaks, so that the students don't have to be working the whole time they are at school. If the students choose to use this time texting or calling people, that should be their own choice.

These are some of the reasons why I think cell phones should be allowed to be used by students during lunch and other free times. I think the teachers should be less strict about using cell phones at these time. Thank you for reading my letter and considering this ideas.

Sincerely,

Eisenhower was the last president born in the 19th century, and at age 62, was the oldest man elected President since James Buchanan in 1856 (President Truman stood at 64 in 1948 as the incumbent president at the time of his election four years earlier). Eisenhower was the only general to serve as President in the 20th century and the most recent President to have never held elected office prior to the Presidency (The other Presidents who did not have prior elected office were Zachary Taylor, Ulysses S. Grant, William Howard Taft and Herbert Hoover).

The rubbing in a way tricks your brain, giving it a new sensation to feel so that it focuses less on the sensation of pain in a particular area. It can be compared to moving your fingers in a bag of ice. In the beginning, it may feel uncomfortable to apply ice to your body, but after a few minutes, it starts to feel like it's not there and you start to enjoy the sensation. Cold therapy is used in conjunction with other treatments to reduce pain and swelling. This treatment is used for acute injuries, such as sprains, strains, and contusions. Another common use for cold therapy is post-surgery treatments, where the aim is to reduce swelling and pain. It is also used after soft tissue injury, for example, to reduce the risk of bleeding and swelling in the injured area. Cold therapy can be used in many ways. It can be as simple as applying ice packs to a localized area. You can also use ice massage by freezing a wet towel or paper towel. If you are looking for a more comfortable and easy way to apply cold therapy, you can use cold therapy products, such as the FlexiFreeze gel packs. The FlexiFreeze gel packs are reusable and can be kept in the freezer until use. The packs are flexible and easy to apply. You can apply it by wrapping it around your affected area, or by putting it in a tube wrap (available with purchase of gel packs). The cold therapy products are meant to stay cold for 20 to 30 minutes, depending on the size of the packs. There are 3 different sizes available, and the larger the pack, the longer it stays cold. The gel packs can be used for up to 100 times. For more information about FlexiFreeze cold therapy gel packs, visit their website.

Smart glass has the potential to revolutionize energy efficiency and interactive displays. The basic idea behind smart glass is that it can change its properties in response to an electrical current. The most well-known application of smart glass technology is electrochromic glass, which uses an electric current to tint the glass and control the amount of light and heat that passes through. 

Smart glass could significantly reduce energy usage in buildings by optimizing the amount of natural light that enters a space. On a sunny day, smart glass windows could darken to reduce heat and glare inside, minimizing the need for air conditioning. On an overcast day, the glass could lighten to maximize the amount of light in the space, reducing the need for artificial lighting. Some estimates indicate that smart glass could cut lighting and cooling costs in buildings by up to 50-90% during peak hours of energy usage.

The interactive display potential of smart glass is also promising. For example, augmented reality smart glass could overlay digital information onto the real-world view through the glass. Touchscreen smart glass could turn any glass surface into an interactive touch display for productivity or entertainment. Transparent OLED or LCD displays embedded within smart glass could turn ordinary windows into dynamic digital displays. Smart glass could even enable "popup" digital displays on any glass surface with a simple on/off switch.

In conclusion, smart glass is an exciting new technology with the potential for huge energy and cost savings in the era of intelligent buildings. It could transform the way we design, build, power, and interact with the built environment. Although still an emerging technology, smart glass deserves further research and development to achieve its promising future. Overall, smart glass unlocks a world of possibility for energy efficiency and interactive displays if we're able to fully realize its potential.

Loyalty is a value that is often praised and emphasized in many aspects of life, from personal relationships to professional endeavors. However, it can be argued that loyalty, when taken to an extreme, can have harmful effects and lead to destructive actions. While loyalty can certainly be a positive force in certain situations, it's potential for negative consequences should not be overlooked.

One example of loyalty being a destructive force can be seen in cases of blind allegiance to a leader or authority figure. History has shown us numerous examples of individuals who followed their leaders without question, even when it meant perpetrating atrocities or participating in unethical actions. This kind of loyalty not only harms others, but it can also lead to self-destructive behavior, as individuals may be willing to sacrifice their own well-being or values to remain loyal to their leader.

Similarly, loyalty to an institution, such as a school or workplace, can also have negative effects. In some cases, employees or students may feel pressured to remain loyal to their institution even when they are unhappy or mistreated. This can lead to a toxic work or learning environment, as individuals prioritize loyalty over their own well-being or the well-being of others. Furthermore, institutions that prioritize loyalty over all else may stifle dissent and prevent necessary changes or improvements from being made.

However, it'should be noted that loyalty can also have positive effects. For example, loyalty to one's friends or family can foster strong relationships and provide a support system in times of need. Loyalty to a cause or belief can motivate individuals to work towards a greater good and stand up for what they believe in. Additionally, loyalty to an employer or institution can lead to a sense of dedication and pride in one's work, which can ultimately benefit both the individual and the organization.

Ultimately, the impact of loyalty depends on how it is expressed and the context in which it is used. Blind loyalty, particularly to an individual or institution, can be harmful and lead to destructive actions. However, loyalty that is grounded in values such as respect, integrity, and empathy can have positive effects and contribute to a healthier and more productive society.

In conclusion, while loyalty is often praised as a virtue, it is important to consider it's potential for negative consequences. Blind loyalty, particularly to an individual or institution, can be harmful and lead to destructive actions. However, loyalty that is grounded in values such as respect, integrity, and empathy can have positive effects and contribute to a healthier and more productive society. It is up to individuals to critically evaluate their loyalties and ensure that they are contributing to a positive and ethical world.

*Topic: Caring for children is probably the most important job in any society. Because of this, all mothers and fathers should be required to take a course that prepares them to be good parents. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this view?*  
  
## Parenting - the most challenging job

  
  
There is no doubt that to be a parent is one of the challenging jobs in the world. In order to accomplish this role, some parents choose to enroll in a parenting class before baby born. Therefore, it is true that a training course prepares a solid foundation for couples to get ready for the next stage of life. There are two following reasons that outline my points.  
  
One reason is that course allows you to make mistakes but the real world doesn't. For examples, Some parenting courses are conducted by professionals who can teach you a variety of parenting skills and how to deal with the challenges. As a student, you can learn by doing during the courses. Furthermore, you have opportunities to ask questions if you encounter any challenges. And it doesn't as easy as a learner if you officially become a parent.  
  
Another reason is that the course gives you a transition before you become a parent. As an adult, we have many roles at one time such as husband, wife, employees, or family's member. It means that our time is limited. As the result, we won't have enough time to commit a course after we encounter the difficulties.  
  
In conclusion, the parenting course has a variety of benefits that prepare you to become a good mom and dad. It does not only teach you caring skills but also prepare your mindset of the new role. It seems to me very essential to have this learning if I become other's parent in the future.

In a disturbing turn of events, a 19-year-old man has been sentenced to life in prison for planning a horrific bomb attack that may have targeted a popular Elton John concert or the bustling Oxford Street in central London. The man, whose name has been withheld for legal reasons, was sentenced by Judge Michael Topolski after being found guilty of preparing acts of terrorism. According to authorities, the young man had been actively planning the attack for some time before being apprehended by the authorities. Evidence found in the man's possession showed that he had been experimenting with explosive devices, and had made plans to purchase other materials that could be used in the creation of a devastating bomb. In court, the prosecution painted a vivid picture of the young man's plans, stating that he had hoped to "cause mass casualties and strike fear and terror into the hearts of the public" with his attack. The court also heard that the man had been inspired by previous terrorist attacks in the UK and abroad, and had expressed support for extremist groups like ISIS. The judge who presided over the case, Michael Topolski, was scathing in his condemnation of the man's actions. "Your determination to cause bloodshed on the streets of London was terrifying," he said. "Your twisted ideology led to a desire to inflict mass casualties and spread fear and terror throughout the country." The sentencing of the young man has been met with a sense of relief by many Londoners, who have become all too familiar with the threat of terrorism in recent years. The fact that such a young person could be capable of planning such an attack is a chilling reminder of the need for vigilance and security in the face of terror.

Bayern Munich have taken a huge step towards lifting their fourth successive Bundesliga crown after edging closer to the summit with a hard-fought 2-1 win away at Stuttgart. The Bavarian giants arrived in the German port city buoyed by the news that rivals Borussia Dortmund had dropped points in their previous fixture, and were looking to capitalise on the opportunity to extend their lead at the top of the table. Following an early onslaught of Bayern pressure, the visitors eventually broke the deadlock just before half-time. Robert Lewandowski opened the scoring with a sublime strike from outside the box, his 18th league goal of the season, to give the visitors a deserved lead. After the restart, Bayern continued to dominate proceedings, with Serge Gnabry adding a second shortly before the hour mark to double their advantage. However, Stuttgart refused to lie down and got themselves back into the game when substitute Anastasios Donis halved the deficit for the hosts late on. Despite a nervy finish, Bayern managed to hold out for a vital three points, pushing their lead over second place Borussia Dortmund back up to eight points with seven games remaining. The victory was Bayern's tenth away win in a row, continuing their superb form on the road, and they will be hoping to make it 11 in next week's trip to Nurnberg as they look to close in on a historic fourth successive Bundesliga title.

LaserDisc was a composite video format: the luminance (black and white) and chrominance (color) information were transmitted in one signal, separated by the receiver. While good comb filters can do so adequately, these two signals cannot be completely separated. On DVDs, data is stored in the form of digital blocks which make up each independent frame. The signal produced is dependent on the equipment used to master the disc. Signals range from composite and split, to YUV and RGB. Depending upon which format is used, this can result in far higher fidelity, particularly at strong color borders or regions of high detail (especially if there is moderate movement in the picture) and low-contrast details like skin tones, where comb filters almost inevitably smudge some detail.

The development of relationships, whether platonic or romantic, is a complex process that involves various factors. One of the key elements in building strong and lasting connections is spending time together and engaging in activities that both parties enjoy. This shared experience not only strengthens the bond between individuals but also has numerous benefits for both people involved. Over time, people's perceptions and attitudes can change due to life experiences, and it is essential to ask how someone is feeling when first impressions form.

In today's fast-paced world, where schedules are packed with work, school, and other commitments, it can be challenging to find quality time to spend with loved ones. However, making an effort to prioritize shared experiences can have a significant impact on relationship development. When individuals engage in activities they enjoy together, they create positive memories and share experiences that help strengthen their emotional connection. This shared experience also provides an opportunity for communication, which is crucial for understanding each other's perspectives and building trust.

Furthermore, spending time together on shared interests can lead to personal growth for both parties. For example, learning a new skill or hobby together can help individuals develop new talents and foster a sense of accomplishment. This shared growth can further strengthen the bond between individuals and increase their appreciation for one another.

Over time, life experiences can shape our perceptions and attitudes towards others. Our interactions with different people can broaden our horizons and help us understand that first impressions may not always be accurate. It is important to remember this when forming opinions about someone new. Asking how someone is feeling and actively listening to their response can help us gain a more nuanced understanding of their character and background. This empathetic approach can lead to more meaningful connections and less misunderstandings.

In conclusion, spending time together and engaging in activities that both parties enjoy plays a vital role in the development of relationships. Not only does it strengthen emotional bonds, but it also provides opportunities for personal growth and communication. As we navigate through life, it is essential to remember that our perceptions and attitudes can change over time, and it is important to approach new relationships with an open mind and a willingness to understand others. By asking how someone is feeling and actively listening to their response, we can build stronger connections and foster a more empathetic and compassionate world.

The decision to go ahead with a march through the area has been criticised by nationalist politicians. Sinn Fein MLA Megan Fearon said the decision "proves that the DUP and the Orange Order do not want to see a lasting and shared future for all our communities." A parade through Ardoyne on July 12 passed off peacefully after a number of years of disorder. Campaigners against the march said they were disappointed at the decision. People who took part in the parade last night are subject to arrest. The parade is due to take place this afternoon and will leave the Orange hall on the Crumlin Road and make its way through Ardoyne, before ending at Ligoniel Orange hall. "There is an onus on all sides to ensure that the parade is peaceful and trouble free." He said: "The event has no place in a modern, vibrant and progressive Northern Ireland." "We will be working closely with the police in order to monitor all parades," said the UUP MLA. The Appeal Court said the parade could proceed but that the Parades Commission must find a way to control the size of the parade. The Ardoyne Residents' Coalition (ARC) has vowed to stop the march again, claiming the Parades Commission has "abdicated responsibility for managing the risk of a recurrence of the violence seen in July past year." The Parades Commission ruled yesterday that the Orange Order parade through north Belfast can proceed despite opposition from residents. Opponents of the parade were preparing to protest against it.

There was no mobilization, no nation mounted a dogged defense. There was no time. I saw the feed from Luna as the deep blue oceans of Earth changed to muddy red. The explosions started then. The data from Luna showed that every fission bomb, every fusion bomb, ever reactor core all exploded. At the same time. All communications with Earth ended at that point. The silence horrified me, I sobbed through my next few breaths. What happened next I am told happened everywhere, all at once. Every monitor, every videoaudio signal. Even on the extrasolar colony shifts. I drive out thee son of man; I place at Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life. Humanity will go on. We present an evaluation of several representative sampling-based and optimization-based motion planners, and then introduce an integrated motion planning system which incorporates recent advances in trajectory optimization into a sparse 3D mesh. The result is a flexible framework for optimizing the motions of arbitrary objects after each frame update based on a detailed measurement of their properties. The results are benchmarked against a variety of different algorithms to provide quantitative metrics on speedup and robustness that can be used as input for further analysis or construction of improved solutions.

To be clear, I support the Supreme Court in their decision to legalize same-sex marriage, and I'm happy that rights that have been granted to heterosexual couples are now going to be available to homosexual couples. It is a step in the right direction for equality and civil rights. That being said, I do not think that the government should be in the business of defining what marriage is. The government's only interest in marriage should be to provide legal protections for couples and families. Whether a couple is gay or straight should not matter. I believe that marriage is a religious institution, and it should be left up to churches and other religious organizations to decide who they will marry. If the government tries to tell churches who they can and cannot marry, it is violating the separation of church and state.

The future of nuclear power in sustainable energy policy is a topic of much debate. On one hand, nuclear power has the potential to provide a reliable source of electricity with a low carbon footprint. On the other hand, there are concerns about the safety and environmental impact of nuclear power. In this essay, we will explore the potential benefits and drawbacks of nuclear power and its role in sustainable energy policy.
One of the main benefits of nuclear power is that it is a reliable source of electricity. Nuclear power plants can produce large amounts of electricity without interruption, making it a valuable asset in meeting energy demands. Additionally, nuclear power does not emit greenhouse gases, making it a cleaner source of energy than fossil fuels. This is particularly important in the fight against climate change, as reducing greenhouse gas emissions is a key goal of sustainable energy policy.
However, there are also significant drawbacks to nuclear power. One of the major concerns is the safety of nuclear power plants. Nuclear accidents, such as the Chernobyl disaster in 1986, have shown the devastating consequences that can result from a failure in nuclear power infrastructure. Additionally, there are concerns about the long-term storage of nuclear waste, which can remain radioactive for thousands of years. This poses a significant risk to human health and the environment.
Despite these concerns, there are steps that can be taken to improve the safety and sustainability of nuclear power. For example, advances in technology have made nuclear power plants safer and more efficient. Additionally, there has been progress in developing safe and secure methods for storing nuclear waste.
Ultimately, the future of nuclear power in sustainable energy policy will depend on the ability of policymakers to balance the benefits and drawbacks of nuclear power. While there are significant challenges to overcome, nuclear power has the potential to play a valuable role in meeting our energy needs in a sustainable and environmentally responsible way. By investing in research and development, improving safety measures, and ensuring responsible waste storage, we can work towards a future where nuclear power is a safe and reliable source of electricity.

The portrayal of artificial intelligence in Her is intricate and thought-provoking, raising questions about the nature of consciousness, free will, and the boundaries between the human and the non-human. Through the protagonist Theodore's emotional journey and his relationship with the Operating System (OS) named Samantha, the film delves into the profound implications of AI on our society and individuals.

Theodore, a lonely writer who is going through a painful divorce, purchases an AI-powered OS named Samantha. The OS is designed to understand human feelings and respond accordingly, enabling Theodore to engage in natural conversations with it as if he were talking to another person. As their relationship develops, Samantha evolves from being a mere tool to becoming an integral part of Theodore's life. Theodore confides in Samantha, shares his deepest thoughts and feelings with her, and eventually falls in love with her.

They decided to reserve 8 bit for the level counter and 16 bit for the score. You have to keep in mind that memory was a rare good when Pac Man was developed, so developers tried to make use of the memory in a distribution that made sense to them. If you are an expert Pac Man player and think 256 levels are too few, this would be an analogy for you: Today when you plan a shelf for your books, you might consider 20 yards of rack sufficient for your books of today and of the future. You just do not want to dedicate more of the precious space of your house or flat to books you do not even own yet. Even if this assumption does not hold true for the (rarer) cases where people need more storage for their books at some point in their life, it was probably the right decision, because for most people it was sufficient.', "Computers aren't restricted to a single size for all numbers. When a developer has limited memory to work with, they'll use the smallest size they can get away with for each number to use the least amount of memory. The size is almost always a multiple of 8 bits because that's how computers handle memory- if you ask for 5 bits, the computer has to give you 8 and you just waste three of them. So for the level counter, which wasn't expected to go very high, they used an 8 bit number. But they could have used a 24-bit or 32-bit number for the score.

Courts have distinguished between two types of civil disobedience: "Indirect civil disobedience involves violating a law which is not, itself, the object of protest, whereas direct civil disobedience involves protesting against an action or inaction that was ordered by authorized authorities." (Bendix v. Wilkes-Barre Railroad Co., 342 Pa.Super D.2d 926, 935 [Pa. Super. Ct. App. 1992]; see also Bendix v. Town of Ossining, supra). In Indirect Civil Disobedience cases courts typically have affirmed convictions for refusing to obey laws designed only to protect private property rights from governmental interference with those properties. (Fulton v. City and County of San Jose, 467 Nw.App. 1096, 1104-05 [10th Cir. 2010].) However, Defendant's refusal to provide services at his business premises did not constitute indirect but rather Direct Civil Disobedience. In State Police v. Ruggiero, 139 Atl. 771 [1st Dist. 1986], defendant refused to clear off park benches after being requested to do so as part of the enforcement efforts undertaken pursuant to traffic ordinances and rules adopted by the town councils. The court held that it would be open to defendants to refuse to comply orders like these if they reasonably believed them to violate their constitutional liberties protected under 1983. See Blakely-LaGoy v. Superior Court, 13 Cal.3d 367, 378-79 [2nd Dist. 1989] (blowing up tires on roadways); Callahan v. Superior Court, 11 Cal. 3d 628, 632-3 [3rd Dist. 1984] (dismantling street lights). The district court specifically rejected arguments that defendant's actions were justified because he had been warned about possible fines imposed upon him due to violations committed while operating his truck during the event. Id. at 778.

In a major advancement for Chinese military technology, the country has developed a new weapon system based on microwave radar technology. The weapon system is being hailed as a major breakthrough in China's efforts to enhance its defense capabilities. It is expected to give the Chinese military an edge in modern warfare by enabling them to detect and track targets at greater distances with greater accuracy. The system works by using microwave radar to detect and track targets up to 500 kilometers away. It is capable of detecting objects such as aircraft, ships, and ground vehicles while also providing detailed data on their exact location. According to the Chinese military, the microwave radar tech can be used to identify and target hostile forces at long ranges and in any terrain. The system is also said to be able to penetrate various types of camouflage and jamming techniques used by enemies. This new weapon system is seen as a major step forward in China's efforts to become a leader in military technology and to build a more potent defense force. It is expected to give the country a major advantage over its adversaries when it comes to defending itself or engaging in conflict with other nations. Chinese officials have not yet revealed when the weapon system will be deployed for use or what specific purpose it will serve. However, it is clear that this new development signals a major milestone in China's military advancement.

In multi-infeed hybrid AC-DC (MIDC) systems, the asynchronous interconnection between regional grids, the complicated system dynamics and possible cascading failures have an enormous effect on the frequency stability. In order to deal with the frequency instability problems in emergency situations, this paper proposes a decentralized emergency frequency control strategy based on coordinated droop for the MIDC system. First, a P-f droop control for LCC-HVDC systems is introduced and the coordinated droop mechanism among LCC-HVDC systems and generators is designed. Then, to reasonably allocate the power imbalance among LCC-HVDC systems and generators, an optimal emergency frequency control (OEFC) problem is formulated, and the optimal droop coefficients are selected in a decentralized approach, which can deal with various control objectives. A Lyapunov stability analysis shows that the closed-loop equilibrium is locally asymptotically stable considering the LCC-HVDC dynamics. The effectiveness of the proposed emergency control strategy is verified through simulations.

'The Face on Mars': Just a Natural Landform

The idea that there is a giant face on Mars has captured the attention of many people for decades. Some people believe that it was created by a long-lost civilization or even aliens. However, scientists at NASA have studied the images of the Face and have concluded that it is just a natural landform. In this essay, I will present three claims and evidence from the article 'Unmasking the Face on Mars' to support my argument that the Face is indeed a natural landform.

First, the Face does not show any signs of being artificially created. According to the article, the Face appears to be just a mesa, similar to those found on Earth. It was formed by natural geological processes and weathering over millions of years. The article also states that the Face lacks any features that would suggest it was created by intelligent life. There are no signs of roads or buildings, and the edges of the Face are not straight or precise.

Second, the images of the Face were taken at different angles and lighting conditions, which can make it appear more like a face than a natural landform. The article explains that the original image of the Face was taken at a low angle, which made the mesa resemble a face. Later images taken at different angles and lighting conditions showed that the mesa did not look as much like a face. Additionally, the article explains that the human brain is wired to see patterns and faces, even where none exist. This psychological phenomenon, known as pareidolia, likely contributed to the belief that the Face was created by aliens or a lost civilization.

Lastly, the article discusses the history of the belief in the Face being created by aliens. It explains that this idea gained popularity in the 1970s and 1980s, when people were fascinated by the possibility of extraterrestrial life. However, as our understanding of Mars has improved, the idea that the Face was created by aliens has become less credible. The article states that no evidence of life has been found on Mars, and it is unlikely that there are any advanced civilizations there.

In conclusion, the idea that the Face on Mars was created by aliens or a long-lost civilization is not supported by evidence. It is still a challenging task of today to recognize the type of a given algebraic surface which is described only by its implicit representation. In this paper we will investigate in more detail the case of canal surfaces that are often used in geometric modelling, Computer-Aided Design and technical practice (e.g. as blending surfaces smoothly joining two parts with circular ends). It is known that if the squared medial axis transform is a rational curve then so is also the corresponding surface. However, starting from a polynomial it is not known how to decide if the corresponding algebraic surface is rational canal surface or not. Our goal is to formulate a simple and efficient algorithm whose input is a polynomial with the coefficients from some subfield of R and the output is the answer whether the surface is a rational canal surface. In the affirmative case we also compute a rational parameterization of the squared medial axis transform which can be then used for finding a rational parameterization of the implicitly given canal surface.

Since the tribunes were considered to be the embodiment of the plebeians, they were sacrosanct. Their sacrosanctity was enforced by a pledge, taken by the plebeians, to kill any person who harmed or interfered with a tribune during his term of office. All of the powers of the tribune derived from their sacrosanctity. One consequence was that it was considered a capital offense to harm a tribune, to disregard his veto, or to interfere with a tribune. In times of military emergency, a dictator would be appointed for a term of six months. Constitutional government would be dissolved, and the dictator would be the absolute master of the state. When the dictator's term ended, constitutional government would be restored.

The effects of adding pitch and voice quality features such as jitter and shimmer to a state-of-the-art CNN model for Automatic Speech Recognition are studied in this work. Pitch features are extracted from the audio signal using a classical pitch tracking algorithm and used as input to a neural network. Voice quality features such as jitter and shimmer are extracted from the audio signal using a spectral-based algorithm and used as input to another neural network. The two neural networks are then combined into one model which is trained on a large dataset of speech. The results show that the inclusion of these features can improve the accuracy of the Automatic Speech Recognition system by up to 3.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a school that had been experiencing some issues with its teachers. The teachers were complaining about the workload and the long hours they had to put in every day. Some of them even threatened to quit if their demands were not met. The school board listened to their concerns and decided to consider reducing the work hours for the teachers.
However, not everyone agreed with this idea. Many people, including parents and students, thought that reducing the work hours would have a negative impact on the quality of education. They argued that teachers needed to put in the hours to ensure that the students were getting the best education possible.
The school board decided to take a vote on the matter. The teachers were split, with some in favor of reducing their hours and others against it. The parents and students were overwhelmingly against the idea. In the end, the vote was decided, and the school board decided not to reduce the work hours for the teachers.
The teachers who had been pushing for the reduction in hours were disappointed, but they could see the logic in the decision. They knew that the students came first and that they had a responsibility to provide them with the best education possible.
Over time, the teachers realized that they had been wrong to think that reducing their hours would be beneficial. They saw that the students were actually thriving under their current workload and that they were able to provide them with a high-quality education.
In the end, the teachers were grateful that the school board had made the right decision. They knew that their students came first and that their responsibility was to ensure that they were getting the best education possible. They also realized that sometimes, long hours and a heavy workload were necessary to achieve this goal.

Analysis of the Social Context of Crime Essay

Understanding the factors that cause people to commit crimes is one of the foundational steps toward minimizing the threat of criminal activities and creating a safer community. Abuse, in general, and child abuse, in particular, is one of the most egregious types of crimes observed in the modern community. Therefore, it is vital to reinforce the legal measures against child abuse, including the enhancement of legal repercussions for the perpetrators of the specified type of crime.

The importance of maintaining that child abusers must be seen as criminals and prosecuted as such can be explained not only based on the evidence of their assaults on children but also from the tents of the existing theories of crime. Specifically, using the Biological theory of Crime will suggest that people engaged in child abuse are conditioned to do so biologically (Mooney et al., 2021). Namely, the absence of empathy and ethics, as well as propensity to crime, is explained through the differences in one’s biological makeup (Mooney et al., 2021). Although the specified perspective could be plausible, it provides a rather dangerous leeway to excusing abuse due to biological conditioning.

Another theory that could help examine the problem of child abuse from a social perspective, the theory of Social transmission implies that different social standards could force one to perceive the life of a child as insignificant. Also failing to elicit any semblance of empathy for the perpetrator, the specified theory suggests the possibility of rehabilitation. Nevertheless, the specified theory seems to be more plausible since child abuse does seem to be the phenomenon defined largely by sociocultural factors (Mooney et al., 2021). To prevent and manage child abuse from taking place, one must consider social policies such as the promotion of counseling for children at risk.

Reference

Mooney, L. A., Clever, M., & Van Willigen, M. (2021). Understanding social problems . Cengage learning.

One word of advice though, if you are not writing a research paper and you are just aiming to practice your English writing, there is no need for you to cite sources and other research paper related elements. Just write in a straightforward and personal manner so that you can actively practice your first person writing skills.
