If I'm not mistaken your describing the system used at better hotels. One sheet goes on the mattress and is tucked under the mattress.... It's the bottom layer your body sleeps on. The next flat sheet is put on the bed With the top of the sheet even with the top of the mattress The duvetcomforter is thrown on next, just like the previous sheet. Now one more sheet is thrown over that. The top three layers are now folded over about two thirds of the way up..... and the pillows are placed where the head would go. That's the type of fold down service I've had at the four seasons and better 4 star hotels. I liked it so much I switched to it myself. You don't even need a duvet cover..... Just the down comforter in between two sheets.,Layers. You sleep on a "fitted sheet" that coveres the mattress. Then, you cover with another thin sheet for those who want the modesty of a blanket without the warmth, or just the slight warmth it offers. Then, there is often another thin-ish cotton or lightly plush blanket, since down duvets are quite warm but sometimes a sheet is not enough. Then, there is some sort of of the duvet (with duvet cover) quiltthicker blanket. Sometimes, there is an original decorative "bedspread," but those are less common then they were in the 80s. Anything beyond that is just a hotel trying to seem fancyluxurious. Pillow cases: you may often see a pillow wrapped in a 2nd pillow case. This is just to keep the pillow cleaner longer, since it's easier to wash a pillow case than the pillow. If you drool a little, or if your eyes water and it gets absorbed into the pillow case, the next layer would normally be the pillow itself...so some people put another pillow case under their "nicer" pillow cases to keep the pillow clean.', "A lot of people have mentioned that one sheet is probably a fitted sheet, but is it possible the third is a mattress pad or something? It would be a little thicker than the others and probably quilted-looking, and either have edges with elastic sewn in like the fitted sheet or elastic bands across the corners. They're supposed to protect the mattress itself from absorbing your sweat and getting gross. In this case the order would go mattress pad, fitted sheet, normal sheet, blanket. Most Americans don't use blankets with cases. When I was in Europe I needed a lesson in how to put the blanket in the case right, lol.

I strongly agree with cell phones being banned while driving. I can honestly say that I have been the car with people who has almost run in to someone's back on numerous occasions because they was focused on texting on their phone. I think driving while using cell phones should be banned because of the many car accidents they are causing, it is causing ones insurance to rise, and it is causing concerns to people health issues. The question is people more concerned more with their phone more than they are with their safety or safety of others

Although cell phones have not been around for a very long time, they have become a key part of our lives. People use their cell phones for just about everything. Unfortunately, people are also choosing the wrong time to be using their cell phones while they are driving. People are willing to risk our personal safety as well as the safety of others because we can't put down our cell phones. While the cell phone has many positive attributes like keeping people in touch, the cell phone becomes very dangerous when a person decides to drive and use it. Many States has passed laws that stops texting and driving such as Georgia hands free law. When driving, sometimes it is difficult to focus on the road which makes it easy to forget that the roads are shared by everyone and not for your own use.

Studies have proved that drivers who use cell phones while driving are more prone to cause accidents. Driving while using a cell phone to drunk driving, in both cases, a person does not have enough focus and mentally to carry out a dangerous activity like driving. Banning cell phone while driving will keep a safe distance from accidents. One cannot focus fully on the road and the other vehicles, if one keeps talking on phone consistently while driving or keeps looking down at their phone.

People whose work depends on a cell phone like lawyers or businessmen say that they always have to be available to answer the phone to keep their business running. However, because of their habits, they can create dangerous and hazardous situations like an accident. Business issues can be stressful and dangerous while driving because it can cause emotional reactions that can lead to tragedy. Because of the conversation they might get upset and this can lower their driving ability that can lead to lose control over the car. So if people don't make a decision to put away their cell phones their routine can harm innocent people.

Concluding if cell phones gets banned everywhere while driving it will decrease the accident and death rate of using a cell phone while driving.

Dear Senator,

I am writing to you today to express my strong support for abolishing the Electoral College and electing the President of the United States by popular vote.

The Electoral College is an outdated system that no longer reflects the will of the people. In the past 20 years, there have been five elections in which the candidate who won the popular vote lost the election. This is unacceptable in a democracy.

The Electoral College also gives disproportionate power to small states. For example, Wyoming has just over 500,000 people, but it has three electoral votes. California, on the other hand, has over 39 million people, but it only has 55 electoral votes. This means that the vote of a person in Wyoming is worth six times as much as the vote of a person in California.

The Electoral College also makes it difficult for third-party candidates to win. This is because third-party candidates typically only win a few electoral votes, which is not enough to win the election. This means that only the two major parties have a realistic chance of winning the presidency.

I urge you to support a bill to abolish the Electoral College and elect the President of the United States by popular vote. This would be a major step forward for democracy in America.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
